REPORT OF TRAFALGAR SQUARE MEETING.Note by the Secretary.AT their meeting on the 18th December, 1944* the War Cabinet invited theMinister of Information to obtain from the B.B.C. and circulate to the WarCabinet the script of the news item given at 6 p.m. and 9 p.m. on the17th December, 1944, about the "Hands off Greece" Demonstration held inTrafalgar Square earlier that day. At the request of the Minister of Informa-tion the B.B.C. have forwarded the script, which is annexed.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W.1,21st December, 1944.ANNEX.Extracts from Home Service News Bulletins on Sunday, 17th December,1944.6 p.m.'' A demonstration with the slogan ' Hands Off Greece' was held inTrafalgar Square to-day, organised by the Fire Brigades' Union. A resolution was carried condemning the policy of the British Government as disastrous andcalling on them to stop using troops against democratic resistance forces in greece. Among the speakers who argued this point of view were two labour.P.s (Dr. Haden Guest and Mr. Parker), and Lord Strabolgi, Mr. TomWintringham, Mr. H. N. Brailsford, Mr. Harry Pollitt and Mr. ComptonMackenzie."9 p.m. and Midnight Bulletins.The above passage from the 6 p.m. bulletin was repeated.WAR CABINET.Copy No./* .W.M.
